comments.text:
(I see this on Galaxy Nexus though I don't see why pixel density should matter here.)

Steps to reproduce:
 1) Load http://daringfireball.net/ in Fennec Native
 2) Double-tap a paragraph
 3) Load http://daringfireball.net/ in Opera Mobile
 4) Double-tap a paragraph.

Actual results:
Initially, both Opera Mobile and Fennec Native lay out the text with slightly longer lines than desktop browsers with their default settings (probably due to different fonts). When double-tapping in Fennec Native, that layout is zoomed without reflowing the lines. When double-tapping in Opera Mobile, the text is reflowed so that the lines become shorter than in desktop browsers and then those shorter lines are zoomed to fit the screen width. As a result, after double-tapping the text is larger and more readable in Opera Mobile than in Fennec Native.

Expected results:
Expected the text to be as large or larger in Fennec Native than in Opera Mobile after double-tapping (while fitting entire lines of text on the screen).
